professions.name: Frontend Developer
professions.description: Develops user interface of web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

professions.name: Backend Developer
professions.description: Works on server-side logic of web applications using programming languages like Java, Python, Node.js, etc.

professions.name: Full Stack Developer
professions.description: Has skills in both frontend and backend development, capable of working with the full stack of technologies.

professions.name: QA Engineer
professions.description: Ensures software quality through manual or automated testing.

professions.name: System Analyst
professions.description: Analyzes and designs information systems based on business requirements.

professions.name: Database Administrator
professions.description: Manages and maintains databases, ensuring data security and performance.

professions.name: Network Engineer
professions.description: Designs and manages computer networks, including network equipment, routing, and security.

professions.name: System Administrator
professions.description: Administers servers, computers, and operating systems in an organization.

professions.name: Business Analyst
professions.description: Analyzes business processes and requirements, develops software specifications.

professions.name: DevOps Engineer
professions.description: Combines development and operations, automates software development and deployment processes.

professions.name: Machine Learning Engineer
professions.description: Works with machine learning algorithms and AI to create intelligent systems and analyze data.

professions.name: Security Engineer
professions.description: Ensures information security, analyzes vulnerabilities, responds to security incidents.

languages.name: JavaScript
languages.description: A popular scripting language used for web development, including both frontend and backend development.

languages.name: Python
languages.description: A high-level programming language known for its simplicity and readability, used in web development, data analysis, machine learning, and more.

languages.name: Java
languages.description: A versatile programming language commonly used for building enterprise applications, mobile apps (Android), and large-scale systems.

languages.name: C++
languages.description: A powerful programming language used for system programming, game development, and high-performance applications.

languages.name: C#
languages.description: A programming language developed by Microsoft for building Windows applications, web services, and games using the .NET framework.

languages.name: PHP
languages.description: A server-side scripting language used for creating dynamic web pages, web applications, and content management systems.

languages.name: Ruby
languages.description: A dynamic and object-oriented programming language known for its simplicity and productivity, commonly used in web development.

languages.name: Swift
languages.description: A programming language developed by Apple for building iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS applications.

languages.name: Kotlin
languages.description: A modern programming language developed by JetBrains, used for Android app development, web development, and more.

languages.name: Go
languages.description: A statically typed and compiled programming language designed for efficiency and scalability, commonly used in cloud services and system programming.

languages.name: R
languages.description: A language and environment for statistical computing and graphics, widely used in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning.

languages.name: TypeScript
languages.description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and other features for building large-scale applications.
